Subsection.Text: The employer shall, in consultation with and with the participation of the policy committee, or, if there is no policy committee, the work place committee or the health and safety representative, develop, implement and monitor a program for the prevention of hazards, including ergonomics-related hazards, in the work place that is appropriate to the size of the work place and the nature of the hazards and that includes the following components:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an implementation plan;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a hazard identification and assessment methodology;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: hazard identification and assessment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: preventive measures;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: employee education; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a program evaluation.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: develop an implementation plan that specifies the time frame for each phase of the development and implementation of the prevention program;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: monitor the progress of the implementation of the preventive measures; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: review the time frame of the implementation plan regularly and, as necessary, revise it.

Subsection.Text: In implementing the prevention program, the employer shall ensure that ergonomics-related hazards are identified and assessed and that they are eliminated or reduced, as required by subsection 19.5(1), as much as is reasonably possible and that any person assigned to identify and assess ergonomics-related hazards has the necessary instruction and training.

The employer shall develop a hazard identification and assessment methodology, including an identification and assessment methodology for ergonomics-related hazards, taking into account the following documents and information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any hazardous occurrence investigation reports;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: first aid records and minor injury records;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: work place health protection programs;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any results of work place inspections;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any employee reports made under paragraph 126(1)(g) or (h) of the Act or under section 15.3;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any government or employer reports, studies and tests concerning the health and safety of employees;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any reports made under the Safety and Health Committees and Representatives Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the record of hazardous substances; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any other relevant information, including ergonomics-related information.

Subsection.Text: The hazard identification and assessment methodology shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the steps and time frame for identifying and assessing the hazards;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the keeping of a record of the hazards; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a time frame for reviewing and, if necessary, revising the methodology.

Section.Text: The employer shall identify and assess the hazards in the work place, including ergonomics-related hazards, in accordance with the methodology developed under section 19.3 taking into account

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nature of the hazard;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of ergonomics-related hazards, all ergonomics-related factors such as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the physical demands of the work activities, the work environment, the work procedures, the organization of the work and the circumstances in which the work activities are performed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the characteristics of materials, goods, persons, animals, things and work spaces and the features of tools and equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the employees’ level of exposure to the hazard;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency and duration of employees’ exposure to the hazard;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effects, real or apprehended, of the exposure on the health and safety of employees;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the preventive measures in place to address the hazard;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any employee reports made under paragraph 126(1)(g) or (h) of the Act or under section 15.3; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any other relevant information.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall, in order to address identified and assessed hazards, including ergonomics-related hazards, take preventive measures to address the assessed hazard in the following order of priority:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the elimination of the hazard, including by way of engineering controls which may involve mechanical aids, equipment design or redesign that take into account the physical attributes of the employee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the reduction of the hazard, including isolating it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the provision of personal protective equipment, clothing, devices or materials; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: administrative procedures, such as the management of hazard exposure and recovery periods and the management of work patterns and methods.

Subsection.Text: As part of the preventive measures, the employer shall develop and implement a preventive maintenance program in order to avoid failures that could result in a hazard to employees.
The employer shall ensure that any preventive measure shall not in itself create a hazard and shall take into account the effects on the work place.
The preventive measures shall include steps to address

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: newly identified hazards in an expeditious manner; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ergonomics-related hazards that are identified when planning implementation of change to the work environment or to work duties, equipment, practices or processes.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall ensure that any person assigned to implement ergonomics-related prevention measures has the necessary instruction and training.
The employer shall provide health and safety education, including education relating to ergonomics, to each employee which shall include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the hazard prevention program implemented in accordance with this Part to prevent hazards applicable to the employee, including the hazard identification and assessment methodology and the preventive measures taken by the employer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nature of the work place and the hazards associated with it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the employee’s duty to report under paragraphs 126(1)(g) and (h) of the Act and under section 15.3; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an overview of the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall provide education to an employee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: whenever new hazard information in respect of a hazard in the work place becomes available to the employer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shortly before the employee is assigned a new activity or exposed to a new hazard.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall review the employee education program, and, if necessary, revise it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least every three years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whenever there is a change in conditions in respect of the hazards; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whenever new hazard information in respect of a hazard in the work place becomes available to the employer.

Subsection.Text: Each time education is provided to an employee, the employee shall acknowledge in writing that they received it, and the employer shall acknowledge in writing that they provided it.

The employer shall keep, in paper or computerized form, records of the education provided to each employee, which shall be kept for a period of two years after the employee ceases to be exposed to a hazard.
The employer shall evaluate the effectiveness of the hazard prevention program, including its ergonomics-related components, and, if necessary, revise it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least every three years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: whenever there is a change in conditions in respect of the hazards; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whenever new hazard information in respect of a hazard in the work place becomes available to the employer.

Subsection.Text: The evaluation of the effectiveness of the prevention program shall be based on the following documents and information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conditions related to the work place and the activities of the employees;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any work place inspection reports;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any hazardous occurrence investigation reports;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any safety audits;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: first aid records and any injury statistics, including records and statistics relating to ergonomics-related first aid and injuries;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: any observations of the policy and work place committees, or the health and safety representative, on the effectiveness of the prevention program; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any other relevant information.

Subsection.Text: If a program evaluation has been conducted under section 19.7, the employer shall prepare a program evaluation report.
The employer shall keep readily available every program evaluation report for six years after the date of the report.

Heading.Label: PART XX
Heading.TitleText: Violence Prevention in the Work Place

Section.Text: The employer shall carry out its obligations under this Part in consultation with and the participation of the policy committee or, if there is no policy committee, the work place committee or the health and safety representative.

In this Part, “work place violence” constitutes any action, conduct, threat or gesture of a person towards an employee in their work place that can reasonably be expected to cause harm, injury or illness to that employee.
The employer shall develop and post at a place accessible to all employees a work place violence prevention policy setting out, among other things, the following obligations of the employer:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to provide a safe, healthy and violence-free work place;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to dedicate sufficient attention, resources and time to address factors that contribute to work place violence including, but not limited to, bullying, teasing, and abusive and other aggressive behaviour and to prevent and protect against it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to communicate to its employees information in its possession about factors contributing to work place violence; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to assist employees who have been exposed to work place violence.

Heading.TitleText: Identification of Factors that Contribute to Work Place Violence

Section.Text: The employer shall identify all factors that contribute to work place violence, by taking into account, at a minimum, the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its experience in dealing with those factors and with work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the experience of employers in dealing with those factors and with violence in similar work places;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the location and circumstances in which the work activities take place;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the employees’ reports of work place violence or the risk of work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the employer’s investigation of work place violence or the risk of work place violence; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the measures that are already in place to prevent and protect against work place violence.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall assess the potential for work place violence, using the factors identified under section 20.4, by taking into account, at a minimum, the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nature of the work activities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the working conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the design of the work activities and surrounding environment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the frequency of situations that present a risk of work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the severity of the adverse consequences to the employee exposed to a risk of work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the observations and recommendations of the policy committee or, if there is no policy committee, the work place committee or the health and safety representative, and of the employees; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the measures that are already in place to prevent and protect against work place violence.

Subsection.Text: The employer, when consulting with the policy committee or, if there is no policy committee, the work place committee or the health and safety representative, shall not disclose information whose disclosure is prohibited by law or could reasonably be expected to threaten the safety of individuals.

Once an assessment of the potential for work place violence has been carried out under section 20.5, the employer shall develop and implement systematic controls to eliminate or minimize work place violence or a risk of work place violence to the extent reasonably practicable.
The controls shall be developed and implemented as soon as practicable, but not later than 90 days after the day on which the risk of work place violence has been assessed.

Once controls referred to in subsection (1) are implemented, the employer shall establish procedures for appropriate follow-up maintenance and corrective measures, including measures to promptly respond to unforeseen risks of work place violence.
Any controls established to eliminate or minimize work place violence shall not create or increase the risk of work place violence.

Heading.TitleText: Work Place Violence Prevention Measures Review

Subsection.Text: The employer shall review the effectiveness of the work place violence prevention measures set out in sections 20.3 to 20.6 and update them whenever there is a change that compromises the effectiveness of those measures, but at least every three years.
The review shall include consideration of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: work place conditions and work locations and activities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: work place inspection reports;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the employees’ reports and the employer’s records of investigations into work place violence or the risk of work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: work place health and safety evaluations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: data on work place violence or the risk of work place violence in the employees’ work place or in similar work places;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the observations of the policy committee, or if there is no policy committee, the work place committee or the health and safety representative; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: other relevant information.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall keep, for a period of three years, a written or electronic record of findings following the review of the work place violence prevention measures, and make it readily available for examination by the Minister.

Heading.TitleText: Procedures in Response to Work Place Violence

Subsection.Text: The employer shall develop in writing and implement emergency notification procedures to summon assistance where immediate assistance is required, in response to work place violence.

The employer shall ensure that employees are made aware of the emergency notification procedures applicable to them and that the text of those procedures is posted at a location readily accessible to those employees.

In the development and implementation of emergency notification procedures, the employer’s decision of whether or not to notify the police shall take into account the nature of the work place violence and the concerns of employees who experienced the work place violence.

If the police are investigating a violent occurrence, the work place committee or the health and safety representative shall be notified of their investigation, unless notification is prohibited by law.
The employer shall develop and implement measures to assist employees who have experienced work place violence.
In this section, competent person means a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is impartial and is seen by the parties to be impartial;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has knowledge, training and experience in issues relating to work place violence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has knowledge of relevant legislation.

Subsection.Text: If an employer becomes aware of work place violence or alleged work place violence, the employer shall try to resolve the matter with the employee as soon as possible.

If the matter is unresolved, the employer shall appoint a competent person to investigate the work place violence and provide that person with any relevant information whose disclosure is not prohibited by law and that would not reveal the identity of persons involved without their consent.
The competent person shall investigate the work place violence and at the completion of the investigation provide to the employer a written report with conclusions and recommendations.
The employer shall, on completion of the investigation into the work place violence,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: keep a record of the report from the competent person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the work place committee or the health and safety representative, as the case may be, with the report of the competent person, providing information whose disclosure is not prohibited by law and that would not reveal the identity of persons involved without their consent; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: adapt or implement, as the case may be, controls referred to in subsection 20.6(1) to prevent a recurrence of the work place violence.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (3) to (5) do not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the work place violence was caused by a person other than an employee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is reasonable to consider that engaging in the violent situation is a normal condition of employment; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the employer has effective procedures and controls in place, involving employees to address work place violence.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall provide information, instruction and training on the factors that contribute to work place violence that are appropriate to the work place of each employee exposed to work place violence or a risk of work place violence.
The employer shall provide information, instruction and training

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before assigning to an employee any new activity for which a risk of work place violence has been identified;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when new information on work place violence becomes available; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at least every three years.

Subsection.Text: The information, instruction and training shall include the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nature and extent of work place violence and how employees may be exposed to it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the communication system established by the employer to inform employees about work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: information on what constitutes work place violence and on the means of identifying the factors that contribute to work place violence;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the work place violence prevention measures that have been developed under sections 20.3 to 20.6; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the employer’s procedures for reporting on work place violence or the risk of work place violence.

Subsection.Text: At least once every three years and in either of the following circumstances, the employer shall review and update, if necessary, the information, instruction and training provided:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when there is a change in respect of the risk of work place violence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when new information on the risk of work place violence becomes available.

Subsection.Text: The employer shall maintain signed records, in paper or electronic form, on the information, instruction and training provided to each employee for a period of two years after the date on which an employee ceases to perform an activity that has a risk of work place violence associated with it.

Section.Text: If an employer complies with the requirements set out in the provisions amended by these Regulations as those provisions read immediately before February 11, 2015, the amendments made by these Regulations do not apply to the employer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: during the period that begins on the day on which these Regulations come into force and ends on November 30, 2018; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of any hazardous products that are in the work place on December 1, 2018, during the period that begins on December 1, 2018 and ends on May 31, 2019.
